thread.title: Protiviti Sponsors Museum of American Finance 'Fireside Chat' and Panel on IPOs and Public vs. Private Funding
thread.title_full: Protiviti Sponsors Museum of American Finance 'Fireside Chat' and Panel on IPOs and Public vs. Private Funding - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Protiviti Sponsors Museum of American Finance 'Fireside Chat' and Panel on IPOs and Public vs. Private Funding
text:
Protiviti
October 28 special event to highlight trends in the IPO marketplace and feature discussions with industry experts
MENLO PARK, Calif. , Oct. 22, 2015 /PRNewswire/ --
WHAT:
Protiviti ( www . protiviti . com ), a global consulting firm, is sponsoring a special event hosted by the Museum of American Finance: "Going Public? A Behind-the-Scenes Look at Public vs. Private Funding."
WHO:
Opening remarks will be delivered by Steve Hobbs, a Protiviti managing director and leader of the firm's Public Company Transformation practice. Hobbs will set the stage for a fireside chat with New York Stock Exchange President Tom Farley and Telis Demos, U.S. capital markets and investment banking reporter for The Wall Street Journal .
Following the chat, a panel discussion will be moderated by Demos, featuring:
Eli Broverman, COO and co-founder, Betterment
Howard Katzenberg, CFO, OnDeck
Sean V. Madnani, senior managing director, Guggenheim Securities, LLC
Howard Morgan, partner and co-founder, First Round Capital
Based on their first-hand experiences, the group will discuss:
The benefits and considerations associated with going public
Private valuations vs. public post-IPO market capitalization
Funding strategies in the private equity and venture capital markets
Make or break decisions facing pre-IPO companies
Lessons learned from recent IPOs
Q&A and reception to follow program.
WHEN:
Wednesday, October 28, 2015
6:00 â€“ 8:00 p.m. EDT
WHERE:
Museum of American Finance
48 Wall Street (at William Street), New York City
HOW:
Reservations are required (seating is limited). Please register at www.moaf.org/IPOpanel ; $25 for general admission; press and museum members are free.
Logo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20090115/AQTH541LOGO
To view the original version on PR Newswire, visit: http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/protiviti-sponsors-museum-of-american-finance-fireside-chat-and-panel-on-ipos-and-public-vs-private-funding-300164577.html
